ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you ever had problems with someone you worked with, including your boss or supervisor, due to their drinking or drug use? (By ''problems'' we mean things like having to cover for someone or work extra hours, it affecting your productivity or ability to do your job, or being in an accident or ''close call'' at work due to someone else's alcohol or drug use.)
When did you experience problems with someone you worked with (including your boss) due to their drinking or drug use? - Within the past 12 months
When did you experience problems with someone you worked with (including your boss) due to their drinking or drug use? - 1-5 years ago
When did you experience problems with someone you worked with (including your boss) due to their drinking or drug use? - 6-10 years ago
When did you experience problems with someone you worked with (including your boss) due to their drinking or drug use? - 11+ years ago
When did you experience problems with someone you worked with (including your boss) due to their drinking or drug use? - No response
What substance(s) had that co-worker been using? - Alcohol
What substance(s) had that co-worker been using? - Marijuana
What substance(s) had that co-worker been using? - Opioid pain pills like Vicodin or OxyContin
What substance(s) had that co-worker been using? - Fentanyl or heroin
What substance(s) had that co-worker been using? - Cocaine
What substance(s) had that co-worker been using? - Stimulants, methamphetamine, or speed
What substance(s) had that co-worker been using? - Some other drug (specify)
What substance(s) had that co-worker been using? - Don't know/not sure
What substance(s) had that co-worker been using? - No response
What substance(s) had that co-worker been using? Other, specify
Because of your coworker's drinking or drug use - How many times have you had to cover for them?
Notes: 1 = More than once; 2 = Once; 5 = Never; 88 = No response

ElementDescription: Because of your coworker's drinking or drug use - How many times has your productivity at work been reduced or has your ability to do your job been negatively affected?
Notes: 1 = More than once; 2 = Once; 5 = Never; 88 = No response

ElementDescription: Because of your coworker's drinking or drug use - How many times were you involved in an accident or a close call at work?
Notes: 1 = More than once; 2 = Once; 5 = Never; 88 = No response

ElementDescription: Because of your coworker's drinking or drug use - How many times have you had to work extra hours?
Notes: 1 = More than once; 2 = Once; 5 = Never; 88 = No response

ElementDescription: How many days out of the last 12 months were you totally unable to work or carry out your normal activities for any reason?
Notes: 0 = 0 days; 1 = 1-2 days; 2 = 3-6 days; 3 = 7-13 days; 4 = 14-29 days; 5 = 30 days or more; 888 = No response

ElementDescription: How many of those (D30) days, when you were totally unable to work, were due to your use of alcohol? If you don't drink alcohol, select 0.
How many of those (D30) days, when you were totally unable to work, were due to your use of drugs? If you don't use drugs, select 0.
How many of those (D30) days, when you were totally unable to work, were due to someone else's use of alcohol?
How many of those (D30) days, when you were totally unable to work, were due to someone else's use of drugs?
